examples: the home of the free and the brave

definitions.text: grant freedom to; free from confinement
remove or force out from a position
examples: The dentist dislodged the piece of food that had been stuck under my gums
He finally could free the legs of the earthquake victim who was buried in the rubble

definitions.text: grant relief or an exemption from a rule or requirement to
examples: She exempted me from the exam
release the list with the names of the prisoners
free a path across the cluttered floor
I absolve you from this responsibility

definitions.text: part with a possession or right
examples: I am relinquishing my bedroom to the long-term house guest
resign a claim to the throne

definitions.text: release (gas or energy) as a result of a chemical reaction or physical decomposition

examples: release the holdings in the dictator's bank account

definitions.text: able to act at will; not hampered; not under compulsion or restraint
examples: feel free to stay as long as you wish

definitions.text: unconstrained or not chemically bound in a molecule or not fixed and capable of relatively unrestricted motion

examples: the detached shutter fell on him
he pulled his arm free and ran
after the Civil War he was a free man

definitions.text: not taken up by scheduled activities

examples: the sentence was devoid of meaning
a loose interpretation of what she had been told
a free translation of the poem
cows in India are running loose
